item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, January 28, 2025 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. We're bringing Pebble back (2194 points | 531 comments)
2. Run DeepSeek R1 Dynamic 1.58-bit (417 points | 148 comments)
3. Osaka bans smoking on all of its streets, vaping included (32 points | 1 comment)
4. Reinforcement Learning – A Reference (97 points | 2 comments)
5. AI, but at What Cost? Breakdown of AI's Carbon Footprint (77 points | 81 comments)
6. Intel slashes prices of Xeon 6 CPUs by up to $5,340 (20 points | 8 comments)
7. Machine Learning in Production (CMU Course) (344 points | 27 comments)
8. Show HN: Browse Anime from the Terminal (22 points | 3 comments)
9. Structured (YC S23) Is Hiring ( | hide)
10. Beautiful Free Math – Desmos Animated Graphing Calculator (42 points | 7 comments)
11. Open-R1: an open reproduction of DeepSeek-R1 (343 points | 183 comments)

13. Turning the database inside-out (2015) (135 points | 55 comments)
14. How Much Do Udemy Instructors Make (2024) (23 points | 15 comments)
15. Google open-sources the Pebble OS (1178 points | 183 comments)

17. DeepSeek could represent Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's worst nightmare (59 points | 76 comments)

19. The Alpha Myth: How captive wolves led us astray (298 points | 257 comments)
20. Go 1.24's go tool is one of the best additions to the ecosystem in years (245 points | 129 comments)
21. How we scaled Slack to support 1000s of developers (142 points | 79 comments)
22. The Taylorator – All Your Frequencies Are Belong to Us (300 points | 89 comments)
23. Facebook ban on discussing Linux? (736 points | 333 comments)
24. Nvidia’s $589B DeepSeek rout (468 points | 967 comments)
25. The Illustrated DeepSeek-R1 (406 points | 67 comments)
26. IOC long shot Watanabe hopes 'crazy' Olympic idea sparks debate (7 points | 4 comments)
27. Using AI for Coding: My Journey with Cline and LLMs (181 points | 77 comments)
28. Dragonsweeper — A minesweeper game that requires observation (147 points | 65 comments)
29. My failed attempt to shrink all NPM packages by 5% (343 points | 222 comments)
30. DeepSeek releases Janus Pro, a text-to-image generator [pdf] (832 points | 610 comments)
